New Records: LeBron James recorded a triple-double in two consecutive games, making him the oldest player in NBA history to do so.
LeBron James became the oldest player to achieve back-to-back triple-doubles at 39 years old.
Key Match Events: The Los Angeles Lakers won the game with a score of 123-103.
LeBron James finished with 19 points, 10 rebounds, 16 assists, and one steal.
Pre-Game Insights: The Lakers were on a four-game home winning streak.
The Raptors were in the middle of a four-game losing streak.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Lakers improved to 6-4 with a win.
The Raptors dropped to 2-9 with the loss.
